26#include <sys/cdefs.h>
27__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_audio.c,v 1.5 2018/08/27 07:56:59 riastradh Exp $");
28
29#include <linux/kernel.h>
30#include <linux/component.h>
31#include <drm/i915_component.h>
32#include "intel_drv.h"
33
34#include <drm/drmP.h>
35#include <drm/drm_edid.h>
36#include "i915_drv.h"
37
38/**
39 * DOC: High Definition Audio over HDMI and Display Port
40 *
41 * The graphics and audio drivers together support High Definition Audio over
42 * HDMI and Display Port. The audio programming sequences are divided into audio
43 * codec and controller enable and disable sequences. The graphics driver
44 * handles the audio codec sequences, while the audio driver handles the audio
45 * controller sequences.
46 *
47 * The disable sequences must be performed before disabling the transcoder or
48 * port. The enable sequences may only be performed after enabling the
49 * transcoder and port, and after completed link training. Therefore the audio
50 * enable/disable sequences are part of the modeset sequence.
51 *
52 * The codec and controller sequences could be done either parallel or serial,
53 * but generally the ELDV/PD change in the codec sequence indicates to the audio
54 * driver that the controller sequence should start. Indeed, most of the
55 * co-operation between the graphics and audio drivers is handled via audio
56 * related registers. (The notable exception is the power management, not
57 * covered here.)
58 *
59 * The struct i915_audio_component is used to interact between the graphics
60 * and audio drivers. The struct i915_audio_component_ops *ops in it is
61 * defined in graphics driver and called in audio driver. The
62 * struct i915_audio_component_audio_ops *audio_ops is called from i915 driver.
63 */
64
65static const struct {
66 int clock;
67 u32 config;
68} hdmi_audio_clock[] = {
69 { 25175, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_25175 },
70 { 25200, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_25200 }, /* default per bspec */
71 { 27000, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_27000 },
72 { 27027, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_27027 },
73 { 54000, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_54000 },
74 { 54054, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_54054 },
75 { 74176, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_74176 },
76 { 74250, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_74250 },
77 { 148352, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_148352 },
78 { 148500, AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_148500 },
79};
80
81/* HDMI N/CTS table */
82#define TMDS_297M 297000
83#define TMDS_296M 296703
84static const struct {
85 int sample_rate;
86 int clock;
87 int n;
88 int cts;
89} aud_ncts[] = {
90 { 44100, TMDS_296M, 4459, 234375 },
91 { 44100, TMDS_297M, 4704, 247500 },
92 { 48000, TMDS_296M, 5824, 281250 },
93 { 48000, TMDS_297M, 5120, 247500 },
94 { 32000, TMDS_296M, 5824, 421875 },
95 { 32000, TMDS_297M, 3072, 222750 },
96 { 88200, TMDS_296M, 8918, 234375 },
97 { 88200, TMDS_297M, 9408, 247500 },
98 { 96000, TMDS_296M, 11648, 281250 },
99 { 96000, TMDS_297M, 10240, 247500 },
100 { 176400, TMDS_296M, 17836, 234375 },
101 { 176400, TMDS_297M, 18816, 247500 },
102 { 192000, TMDS_296M, 23296, 281250 },
103 { 192000, TMDS_297M, 20480, 247500 },
104};
105
106/* get AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_* value for mode */
107static u32 audio_config_hdmi_pixel_clock(const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
108{
109 int i;
110
111 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(hdmi_audio_clock); i++) {
112 if (adjusted_mode->crtc_clock == hdmi_audio_clock[i].clock)
113 break;
114 }
115
116 if (i == ARRAY_SIZE(hdmi_audio_clock)) {
117 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("HDMI audio pixel clock setting for %d not found, falling back to defaults\n",
118 adjusted_mode->crtc_clock);
119 i = 1;
120 }
121
122 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Configuring HDMI audio for pixel clock %d (0x%08x)\n",
123 hdmi_audio_clock[i].clock,
124 hdmi_audio_clock[i].config);
125
126 return hdmi_audio_clock[i].config;
127}
128
129static int audio_config_get_n(const struct drm_display_mode *mode, int rate)
130{
131 int i;
132
133 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(aud_ncts); i++) {
134 if ((rate == aud_ncts[i].sample_rate) &&
135 (mode->clock == aud_ncts[i].clock)) {
136 return aud_ncts[i].n;
137 }
138 }
139 return 0;
140}
141
142static uint32_t audio_config_setup_n_reg(int n, uint32_t val)
143{
144 int n_low, n_up;
145 uint32_t tmp = val;
146
147 n_low = n & 0xfff;
148 n_up = (n >> 12) & 0xff;
149 tmp &= ~(AUD_CONFIG_UPPER_N_MASK | AUD_CONFIG_LOWER_N_MASK);
150 tmp |= ((n_up << AUD_CONFIG_UPPER_N_SHIFT) |
151 (n_low << AUD_CONFIG_LOWER_N_SHIFT) |
152 AUD_CONFIG_N_PROG_ENABLE);
153 return tmp;
154}
155
156/* check whether N/CTS/M need be set manually */
157static bool audio_rate_need_prog(struct intel_crtc *crtc,
158 const struct drm_display_mode *mode)
159{
160 if (((mode->clock == TMDS_297M) ||
161 (mode->clock == TMDS_296M)) &&
162 intel_pipe_has_type(crtc, INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI))
163 return true;
164 else
165 return false;
166}
167
168static bool intel_eld_uptodate(struct drm_connector *connector,
169 int reg_eldv, uint32_t bits_eldv,
170 int reg_elda, uint32_t bits_elda,
171 int reg_edid)
172{
173 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = connector->dev->dev_private;
174 uint8_t *eld = connector->eld;
175 uint32_t tmp;
176 int i;
177
178 tmp = I915_READ(reg_eldv);
179 tmp &= bits_eldv;
180
181 if (!tmp)
182 return false;
183
184 tmp = I915_READ(reg_elda);
185 tmp &= ~bits_elda;
186 I915_WRITE(reg_elda, tmp);
187
188 for (i = 0; i < drm_eld_size(eld) / 4; i++)
189 if (I915_READ(reg_edid) != *((const uint32_t *)eld + i))
190 return false;
191
192 return true;
193}
194
195static void g4x_audio_codec_disable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
196{
197 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->base.dev->dev_private;
198 uint32_t eldv, tmp;
199
200 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Disable audio codec\n");
201
202 tmp = I915_READ(G4X_AUD_VID_DID);
203 if (tmp == INTEL_AUDIO_DEVBLC || tmp == INTEL_AUDIO_DEVCL)
204 eldv = G4X_ELDV_DEVCL_DEVBLC;
205 else
206 eldv = G4X_ELDV_DEVCTG;
207
208 /* Invalidate ELD */
209 tmp = I915_READ(G4X_AUD_CNTL_ST);
210 tmp &= ~eldv;
211 I915_WRITE(G4X_AUD_CNTL_ST, tmp);
212}
213
214static void g4x_audio_codec_enable(struct drm_connector *connector,
215 struct intel_encoder *encoder,
216 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
217{
218 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = connector->dev->dev_private;
219 uint8_t *eld = connector->eld;
220 uint32_t eldv;
221 uint32_t tmp;
222 int len, i;
223
224 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Enable audio codec, %u bytes ELD\n", eld[2]);
225
226 tmp = I915_READ(G4X_AUD_VID_DID);
227 if (tmp == INTEL_AUDIO_DEVBLC || tmp == INTEL_AUDIO_DEVCL)
228 eldv = G4X_ELDV_DEVCL_DEVBLC;
229 else
230 eldv = G4X_ELDV_DEVCTG;
231
232 if (intel_eld_uptodate(connector,
233 G4X_AUD_CNTL_ST, eldv,
234 G4X_AUD_CNTL_ST, G4X_ELD_ADDR_MASK,
235 G4X_HDMIW_HDMIEDID))
236 return;
237
238 tmp = I915_READ(G4X_AUD_CNTL_ST);
239 tmp &= ~(eldv | G4X_ELD_ADDR_MASK);
240 len = (tmp >> 9) & 0x1f; /* ELD buffer size */
241 I915_WRITE(G4X_AUD_CNTL_ST, tmp);
242
243 len = min(drm_eld_size(eld) / 4, len);
244 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("ELD size %d\n", len);
245 for (i = 0; i < len; i++)
246 I915_WRITE(G4X_HDMIW_HDMIEDID, *((const uint32_t *)eld + i));
247
248 tmp = I915_READ(G4X_AUD_CNTL_ST);
249 tmp |= eldv;
250 I915_WRITE(G4X_AUD_CNTL_ST, tmp);
251}
252
253static void hsw_audio_codec_disable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
254{
255 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->base.dev->dev_private;
256 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
257 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
258 uint32_t tmp;
259
260 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Disable audio codec on pipe %c\n", pipe_name(pipe));
261
262 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
263
264 /* Disable timestamps */
265 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe));
266 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_N_VALUE_INDEX;
267 tmp |= AUD_CONFIG_N_PROG_ENABLE;
268 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_UPPER_N_MASK;
269 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_LOWER_N_MASK;
270 if (intel_pipe_has_type(intel_crtc, INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT))
271 tmp |= AUD_CONFIG_N_VALUE_INDEX;
272 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe), tmp);
273
274 /* Invalidate ELD */
275 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_PIN_ELD_CP_VLD);
276 tmp &= ~AUDIO_ELD_VALID(pipe);
277 tmp &= ~AUDIO_OUTPUT_ENABLE(pipe);
278 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_PIN_ELD_CP_VLD, tmp);
279
280 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
281}
282
283static void hsw_audio_codec_enable(struct drm_connector *connector,
284 struct intel_encoder *encoder,
285 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
286{
287 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = connector->dev->dev_private;
288 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
289 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
290 struct i915_audio_component *acomp = dev_priv->audio_component;
291 const uint8_t *eld = connector->eld;
292 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port =
293 enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base);
294 enum port port = intel_dig_port->port;
295 uint32_t tmp;
296 int len, i;
297 int n, rate;
298
299 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Enable audio codec on pipe %c, %u bytes ELD\n",
300 pipe_name(pipe), drm_eld_size(eld));
301
302 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
303
304 /* Enable audio presence detect, invalidate ELD */
305 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_PIN_ELD_CP_VLD);
306 tmp |= AUDIO_OUTPUT_ENABLE(pipe);
307 tmp &= ~AUDIO_ELD_VALID(pipe);
308 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_PIN_ELD_CP_VLD, tmp);
309
310 /*
311 * FIXME: We're supposed to wait for vblank here, but we have vblanks
312 * disabled during the mode set. The proper fix would be to push the
313 * rest of the setup into a vblank work item, queued here, but the
314 * infrastructure is not there yet.
315 */
316
317 /* Reset ELD write address */
318 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_DIP_ELD_CTRL(pipe));
319 tmp &= ~IBX_ELD_ADDRESS_MASK;
320 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_DIP_ELD_CTRL(pipe), tmp);
321
322 /* Up to 84 bytes of hw ELD buffer */
323 len = min(drm_eld_size(eld), 84);
324 for (i = 0; i < len / 4; i++)
325 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_EDID_DATA(pipe), *((const uint32_t *)eld + i));
326
327 /* ELD valid */
328 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_PIN_ELD_CP_VLD);
329 tmp |= AUDIO_ELD_VALID(pipe);
330 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_PIN_ELD_CP_VLD, tmp);
331
332 /* Enable timestamps */
333 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe));
334 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_N_VALUE_INDEX;
335 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_MASK;
336 if (intel_pipe_has_type(intel_crtc, INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT))
337 tmp |= AUD_CONFIG_N_VALUE_INDEX;
338 else
339 tmp |= audio_config_hdmi_pixel_clock(adjusted_mode);
340
341 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_N_PROG_ENABLE;
342 if (audio_rate_need_prog(intel_crtc, adjusted_mode)) {
343 if (!acomp)
344 rate = 0;
345 else if (port >= PORT_A && port <= PORT_E)
346 rate = acomp->aud_sample_rate[port];
347 else {
348 DRM_ERROR("invalid port: %d\n", port);
349 rate = 0;
350 }
351 n = audio_config_get_n(adjusted_mode, rate);
352 if (n != 0)
353 tmp = audio_config_setup_n_reg(n, tmp);
354 else
355 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("no suitable N value is found\n");
356 }
357
358 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe), tmp);
359
360 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
361}
362
363static void ilk_audio_codec_disable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
364{
365 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->base.dev->dev_private;
366 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
367 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port =
368 enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base);
369 enum port port = intel_dig_port->port;
370 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
371 uint32_t tmp, eldv;
372 int aud_config;
373 int aud_cntrl_st2;
374
375 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Disable audio codec on port %c, pipe %c\n",
376 port_name(port), pipe_name(pipe));
377
378 if (WARN_ON(port == PORT_A))
379 return;
380
381 if (HAS_PCH_IBX(dev_priv->dev)) {
382 aud_config = IBX_AUD_CFG(pipe);
383 aud_cntrl_st2 = IBX_AUD_CNTL_ST2;
384 } else if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev_priv)) {
385 aud_config = VLV_AUD_CFG(pipe);
386 aud_cntrl_st2 = VLV_AUD_CNTL_ST2;
387 } else {
388 aud_config = CPT_AUD_CFG(pipe);
389 aud_cntrl_st2 = CPT_AUD_CNTRL_ST2;
390 }
391
392 /* Disable timestamps */
393 tmp = I915_READ(aud_config);
394 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_N_VALUE_INDEX;
395 tmp |= AUD_CONFIG_N_PROG_ENABLE;
396 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_UPPER_N_MASK;
397 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_LOWER_N_MASK;
398 if (intel_pipe_has_type(intel_crtc, INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT))
399 tmp |= AUD_CONFIG_N_VALUE_INDEX;
400 I915_WRITE(aud_config, tmp);
401
402 eldv = IBX_ELD_VALID(port);
403
404 /* Invalidate ELD */
405 tmp = I915_READ(aud_cntrl_st2);
406 tmp &= ~eldv;
407 I915_WRITE(aud_cntrl_st2, tmp);
408}
409
410static void ilk_audio_codec_enable(struct drm_connector *connector,
411 struct intel_encoder *encoder,
412 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
413{
414 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = connector->dev->dev_private;
415 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
416 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port =
417 enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base);
418 enum port port = intel_dig_port->port;
419 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
420 uint8_t *eld = connector->eld;
421 uint32_t eldv;
422 uint32_t tmp;
423 int len, i;
424 int hdmiw_hdmiedid;
425 int aud_config;
426 int aud_cntl_st;
427 int aud_cntrl_st2;
428
429 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Enable audio codec on port %c, pipe %c, %u bytes ELD\n",
430 port_name(port), pipe_name(pipe), drm_eld_size(eld));
431
432 if (WARN_ON(port == PORT_A))
433 return;
434
435 /*
436 * FIXME: We're supposed to wait for vblank here, but we have vblanks
437 * disabled during the mode set. The proper fix would be to push the
438 * rest of the setup into a vblank work item, queued here, but the
439 * infrastructure is not there yet.
440 */
441
442 if (HAS_PCH_IBX(connector->dev)) {
443 hdmiw_hdmiedid = IBX_HDMIW_HDMIEDID(pipe);
444 aud_config = IBX_AUD_CFG(pipe);
445 aud_cntl_st = IBX_AUD_CNTL_ST(pipe);
446 aud_cntrl_st2 = IBX_AUD_CNTL_ST2;
447 } else if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(connector->dev)) {
448 hdmiw_hdmiedid = VLV_HDMIW_HDMIEDID(pipe);
449 aud_config = VLV_AUD_CFG(pipe);
450 aud_cntl_st = VLV_AUD_CNTL_ST(pipe);
451 aud_cntrl_st2 = VLV_AUD_CNTL_ST2;
452 } else {
453 hdmiw_hdmiedid = CPT_HDMIW_HDMIEDID(pipe);
454 aud_config = CPT_AUD_CFG(pipe);
455 aud_cntl_st = CPT_AUD_CNTL_ST(pipe);
456 aud_cntrl_st2 = CPT_AUD_CNTRL_ST2;
457 }
458
459 eldv = IBX_ELD_VALID(port);
460
461 /* Invalidate ELD */
462 tmp = I915_READ(aud_cntrl_st2);
463 tmp &= ~eldv;
464 I915_WRITE(aud_cntrl_st2, tmp);
465
466 /* Reset ELD write address */
467 tmp = I915_READ(aud_cntl_st);
468 tmp &= ~IBX_ELD_ADDRESS_MASK;
469 I915_WRITE(aud_cntl_st, tmp);
470
471 /* Up to 84 bytes of hw ELD buffer */
472 len = min(drm_eld_size(eld), 84);
473 for (i = 0; i < len / 4; i++)
474 I915_WRITE(hdmiw_hdmiedid, *((const uint32_t *)eld + i));
475
476 /* ELD valid */
477 tmp = I915_READ(aud_cntrl_st2);
478 tmp |= eldv;
479 I915_WRITE(aud_cntrl_st2, tmp);
480
481 /* Enable timestamps */
482 tmp = I915_READ(aud_config);
483 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_N_VALUE_INDEX;
484 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_N_PROG_ENABLE;
485 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_PIXEL_CLOCK_HDMI_MASK;
486 if (intel_pipe_has_type(intel_crtc, INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT))
487 tmp |= AUD_CONFIG_N_VALUE_INDEX;
488 else
489 tmp |= audio_config_hdmi_pixel_clock(adjusted_mode);
490 I915_WRITE(aud_config, tmp);
491}
492
493/**
494 * intel_audio_codec_enable - Enable the audio codec for HD audio
495 * @intel_encoder: encoder on which to enable audio
496 *
497 * The enable sequences may only be performed after enabling the transcoder and
498 * port, and after completed link training.
499 */
500void intel_audio_codec_enable(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
501{
502 struct drm_encoder *encoder = &intel_encoder->base;
503 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
504 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode;
505 struct drm_connector *connector;
506 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
507 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
508 struct i915_audio_component *acomp = dev_priv->audio_component;
509 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
510 enum port port = intel_dig_port->port;
511
512 connector = drm_select_eld(encoder);
513 if (!connector)
514 return;
515
516 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("ELD on [CONNECTOR:%d:%s], [ENCODER:%d:%s]\n",
517 connector->base.id,
518 connector->name,
519 connector->encoder->base.id,
520 connector->encoder->name);
521
522 /* ELD Conn_Type */
523 connector->eld[5] &= ~(3 << 2);
524 if (intel_pipe_has_type(crtc, INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT))
525 connector->eld[5] |= (1 << 2);
526
527 connector->eld[6] = drm_av_sync_delay(connector, adjusted_mode) / 2;
528
529 if (dev_priv->display.audio_codec_enable)
530 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_enable(connector, intel_encoder,
531 adjusted_mode);
532
533 if (acomp && acomp->audio_ops && acomp->audio_ops->pin_eld_notify)
534 acomp->audio_ops->pin_eld_notify(acomp->audio_ops->audio_ptr, (int) port);
535}
536
537/**
538 * intel_audio_codec_disable - Disable the audio codec for HD audio
539 * @intel_encoder: encoder on which to disable audio
540 *
541 * The disable sequences must be performed before disabling the transcoder or
542 * port.
543 */
544void intel_audio_codec_disable(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder)
545{
546 struct drm_encoder *encoder = &intel_encoder->base;
547 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
548 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
549 struct i915_audio_component *acomp = dev_priv->audio_component;
550 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
551 enum port port = intel_dig_port->port;
552
553 if (dev_priv->display.audio_codec_disable)
554 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_disable(intel_encoder);
555
556 if (acomp && acomp->audio_ops && acomp->audio_ops->pin_eld_notify)
557 acomp->audio_ops->pin_eld_notify(acomp->audio_ops->audio_ptr, (int) port);
558}
559
560/**
561 * intel_init_audio - Set up chip specific audio functions
562 * @dev: drm device
563 */
564void intel_init_audio(struct drm_device *dev)
565{
566 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
567
568 if (IS_G4X(dev)) {
569 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_enable = g4x_audio_codec_enable;
570 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_disable = g4x_audio_codec_disable;
571 } else if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev)) {
572 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_enable = ilk_audio_codec_enable;
573 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_disable = ilk_audio_codec_disable;
574 } else if (IS_HASWELL(dev) || INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8) {
575 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_enable = hsw_audio_codec_enable;
576 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_disable = hsw_audio_codec_disable;
577 } else if (HAS_PCH_SPLIT(dev)) {
578 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_enable = ilk_audio_codec_enable;
579 dev_priv->display.audio_codec_disable = ilk_audio_codec_disable;
580 }
581}
582
583#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX intel audio */
584
585static void i915_audio_component_get_power(struct device *dev)
586{
587 intel_display_power_get(dev_to_i915(dev), POWER_DOMAIN_AUDIO);
588}
589
590static void i915_audio_component_put_power(struct device *dev)
591{
592 intel_display_power_put(dev_to_i915(dev), POWER_DOMAIN_AUDIO);
593}
594
595static void i915_audio_component_codec_wake_override(struct device *dev,
596 bool enable)
597{
598 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev_to_i915(dev);
599 u32 tmp;
600
601 if (!IS_SKYLAKE(dev_priv))
602 return;
603
604 /*
605 * Enable/disable generating the codec wake signal, overriding the
606 * internal logic to generate the codec wake to controller.
607 */
608 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_CHICKENBIT);
609 tmp &= ~SKL_AUD_CODEC_WAKE_SIGNAL;
610 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_CHICKENBIT, tmp);
611 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
612
613 if (enable) {
614 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_CHICKENBIT);
615 tmp |= SKL_AUD_CODEC_WAKE_SIGNAL;
616 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_CHICKENBIT, tmp);
617 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
618 }
619}
620
621/* Get CDCLK in kHz */
622static int i915_audio_component_get_cdclk_freq(struct device *dev)
623{
624 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev_to_i915(dev);
625 int ret;
626
627 if (WARN_ON_ONCE(!HAS_DDI(dev_priv)))
628 return -ENODEV;
629
630 intel_display_power_get(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_AUDIO);
631 ret = dev_priv->display.get_display_clock_speed(dev_priv->dev);
632
633 intel_display_power_put(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_AUDIO);
634
635 return ret;
636}
637
638static int i915_audio_component_sync_audio_rate(struct device *dev,
639 int port, int rate)
640{
641 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev_to_i915(dev);
642 struct drm_device *drm_dev = dev_priv->dev;
643 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder;
644 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port;
645 struct intel_crtc *crtc;
646 struct drm_display_mode *mode;
647 struct i915_audio_component *acomp = dev_priv->audio_component;
648 enum i915_pipe pipe = -1;
649 u32 tmp;
650 int n;
651
652 /* HSW, BDW SKL need this fix */
653 if (!IS_SKYLAKE(dev_priv) &&
654 !IS_BROADWELL(dev_priv) &&
655 !IS_HASWELL(dev_priv))
656 return 0;
657
658 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
659 /* 1. get the pipe */
660 for_each_intel_encoder(drm_dev, intel_encoder) {
661 if (intel_encoder->type != INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI)
662 continue;
663 intel_dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(&intel_encoder->base);
664 if (port == intel_dig_port->port) {
665 crtc = to_intel_crtc(intel_encoder->base.crtc);
666 if (!crtc) {
667 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("%s: crtc is NULL\n", __func__);
668 continue;
669 }
670 pipe = crtc->pipe;
671 break;
672 }
673 }
674
675 if (pipe == INVALID_PIPE) {
676 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("no pipe for the port %c\n", port_name(port));
677 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
678 return -ENODEV;
679 }
680 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("pipe %c connects port %c\n",
681 pipe_name(pipe), port_name(port));
682 mode = &crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode;
683
684 /* port must be valid now, otherwise the pipe will be invalid */
685 acomp->aud_sample_rate[port] = rate;
686
687 /* 2. check whether to set the N/CTS/M manually or not */
688 if (!audio_rate_need_prog(crtc, mode)) {
689 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe));
690 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_N_PROG_ENABLE;
691 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe), tmp);
692 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
693 return 0;
694 }
695
696 n = audio_config_get_n(mode, rate);
697 if (n == 0) {
698 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Using automatic mode for N value on port %c\n",
699 port_name(port));
700 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe));
701 tmp &= ~AUD_CONFIG_N_PROG_ENABLE;
702 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe), tmp);
703 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
704 return 0;
705 }
706
707 /* 3. set the N/CTS/M */
708 tmp = I915_READ(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe));
709 tmp = audio_config_setup_n_reg(n, tmp);
710 I915_WRITE(HSW_AUD_CFG(pipe), tmp);
711
712 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->av_mutex);
713 return 0;
714}
715
716static const struct i915_audio_component_ops i915_audio_component_ops = {
717 .owner = THIS_MODULE,
718 .get_power = i915_audio_component_get_power,
719 .put_power = i915_audio_component_put_power,
720 .codec_wake_override = i915_audio_component_codec_wake_override,
721 .get_cdclk_freq = i915_audio_component_get_cdclk_freq,
722 .sync_audio_rate = i915_audio_component_sync_audio_rate,
723};
724
725static int i915_audio_component_bind(struct device *i915_dev,
726 struct device *hda_dev, void *data)
727{
728 struct i915_audio_component *acomp = data;
729 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev_to_i915(i915_dev);
730 int i;
731
732 if (WARN_ON(acomp->ops || acomp->dev))
733 return -EEXIST;
734
735 drm_modeset_lock_all(dev_priv->dev);
736 acomp->ops = &i915_audio_component_ops;
737 acomp->dev = i915_dev;
738 BUILD_BUG_ON(MAX_PORTS != I915_MAX_PORTS);
739 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(acomp->aud_sample_rate); i++)
740 acomp->aud_sample_rate[i] = 0;
741 dev_priv->audio_component = acomp;
742 drm_modeset_unlock_all(dev_priv->dev);
743
744 return 0;
745}
746
747static void i915_audio_component_unbind(struct device *i915_dev,
748 struct device *hda_dev, void *data)
749{
750 struct i915_audio_component *acomp = data;
751 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev_to_i915(i915_dev);
752
753 drm_modeset_lock_all(dev_priv->dev);
754 acomp->ops = NULL;
755 acomp->dev = NULL;
756 dev_priv->audio_component = NULL;
757 drm_modeset_unlock_all(dev_priv->dev);
758}
759
760static const struct component_ops i915_audio_component_bind_ops = {
761 .bind = i915_audio_component_bind,
762 .unbind = i915_audio_component_unbind,
763};
764
765#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
766
767/**
768 * i915_audio_component_init - initialize and register the audio component
769 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
770 *
771 * This will register with the component framework a child component which
772 * will bind dynamically to the snd_hda_intel driver's corresponding master
773 * component when the latter is registered. During binding the child
774 * initializes an instance of struct i915_audio_component which it receives
775 * from the master. The master can then start to use the interface defined by
776 * this struct. Each side can break the binding at any point by deregistering
777 * its own component after which each side's component unbind callback is
778 * called.
779 *
780 * We ignore any error during registration and continue with reduced
781 * functionality (i.e. without HDMI audio).
782 */
783void i915_audio_component_init(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
784{
785#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX intel audio */
786 int ret;
787
788 ret = component_add(dev_priv->dev->dev, &i915_audio_component_bind_ops);
789 if (ret < 0) {
790 DRM_ERROR("failed to add audio component (%d)\n", ret);
791 /* continue with reduced functionality */
792 return;
793 }
794#endif
795
796 dev_priv->audio_component_registered = true;
797}
798
799/**
800 * i915_audio_component_cleanup - deregister the audio component
801 * @dev_priv: i915 device instance
802 *
803 * Deregisters the audio component, breaking any existing binding to the
804 * corresponding snd_hda_intel driver's master component.
805 */
806void i915_audio_component_cleanup(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv)
807{
808 if (!dev_priv->audio_component_registered)
809 return;
810
811#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX intel audio */
812 component_del(dev_priv->dev->dev, &i915_audio_component_bind_ops);
813#endif
814 dev_priv->audio_component_registered = false;
815}
